prompt: Write satirical article with headline: "'This Ain’t It, Chief' Updated To 'This Ain’t It, Noble Indigenous Tribal Leader'"
reference: U.S. - The popular internet comment response "This ain't it, chief," has been rightfully seen by many as problematic for years as it appropriates Native American culture in a derisive way, using the word "chief," which everybody knows is an offensive term. Native Americans have spent countless hours weeping since it was first coined.New Internet guidelines state that people must now say, "This ain't it, noble indigenous tribal leader." Leading social media platforms have already begun to implement an algorithm that automatically corrects the text any time a user types in the dated phrase. Experts say this will solve racism.The decision was arrived at after a recent Twitter user responded to a problematic tweet by saying, "this ain't it, chief" which led to another user responding, "This ain't it, CHIEF?! THIS ain't it, ch-- ch--" causing the software to meltdown, resulting in a momentary Twitter outage.Those who attempt to use the phrase in its out-dated format will be flagged and visited by the authorities.
candidate: ***In a dramatic development, the classic phrase "This ain’t it, Chief" is being updated to include a more inclusive and respectful designation for Native American leaders, who have long been an underserved and misunderstood segment of society. "This ain’t it, Noble Indigenous Tribal Leader," or TAINTL, aims to empower Native American leaders and correct the inaccurate stereotypes that have plagued their communities.Speaking at a press conference held at the White House, former President and outspoken TAINTL advocate Donald Trump explained the necessity of the new phrase. "You gotta catch up with the times. Back in the day, I would just be like 'this ain’t it, Chief,' but look, we've made some progress since the old days, right?" While some may consider the phrase to be nothing more than a catchy meme devoid of any real impact, TAINTL has been making significant inroads since its inception into popular culture over the past few months. One notable example of TAINTL's effect occurred at a recent Senate hearing, where a group of Indigenous Tribal Leaders were in attendance to provide crucial insights into new legislation designed to benefit their communities. According to eyewitnesses, the atmosphere in the room became noticeably more respectful and attentive as the Tribal Leaders spoke, with many lawmakers quietly acknowledging the significance of the moment."It was as though the air was cleared, oxygenated by the respectful acknowledgment of these Noble Indigenous Tribal Leaders," recounted one observer.Another impactful instance of the TAINTL movement occurred at a popular comedy club, where a comedian typically relied on tired stereotypes and caricatures of Native Americans to elicit laughs. Audience members were shocked when, instead, the comedian delivered a set filled with accurate, respectful, and insightful commentary on the Native American experience that challenged long-held misconceptions. While initial pushback from those set in their ways of Indigenous characterization has been notable, the TAINTL movement has largely been embraced across the country. Experts are hopeful that this shift in vocabulary and understanding will lead to meaningful strides in inclusivity and cultural sensitivity. As one prominent Tribal Leader, Wakinyan LaPointe, stated, "It is a small but important step towards recognizing the immense cultural and historical weight of Native Americans. We are a people with a long legacy of injustice perpetrated against us, but also a vibrant, living culture to be celebrated." With any luck, the update from "This Ain’t It, Chief" to "This Ain’t It, Noble Indigenous Tribal Leader" will continue to capture the nation's attention and inspire more people to educate themselves on Native American culture and the issues their communities face. After all, as the late great Pete Alonso so often exclaimed: "We are all in this together, and when one of us wins, we all win!"***It is important to note that while this article has employed satirical liberties, the issue of culturally sensitive representation is no laughing matter. Let us endeavor to learn more about the diverse cultures that make up our great country and work towards a more inclusive society.

prompt: Write satirical article with headline: "Using Our Prophetic Powers For Good: The Babylon Bee Will Now Only Write Articles About Positive Things Happening To Humanity"
reference: U.S. - Over the past few years, we have noticed a disturbing trend in our satire: it comes true. In the beginning, we thought it was just coincidence, but as the fulfilled prophecies continued to stack up, we came to accept the truth. We here at the Babylon Bee have been given the gift of prophetic vision, and it's time to use that spiritual gift for the good of mankind.It has therefore been decided that we will only make jokes about cool and good things so our future will be cool and good. Here are some of our headlines. Enjoy your new future!We have more, but that's probably enough goodness for now. We don't want to overdo it. You're welcome, world!
candidate: Using Our Prophetic Powers For Good: The Babylon Bee Will Now Only Write About Positive Things Happening To HumanityBabylon Bee fans have been thrilled by the satirical website's latest announcement that they will now only write articles about wonderful things happening to humanity. "We realized we were just being cynical and divisive with our satirical coverage of earth-shattering events clearly prophesied in the Bible," explained founder Adam Ford, "and we wanted to turn over a new leaf and focus on the positive things that are happening in the world today."In fact, Ford was so inspired by the goodness that God has been doing in these last days that he plans to expand the Bee's content pool to include more stories about people group's experiences with encountering the loving, kind Jesus Christ and less about the impending doom and societal decay of secular society."God's people have always been called to speak truth to power, and that's exactly what we plan to do," Ford continued. "But that truth is more important now than ever, especially when so many are abandoning their faith in the risen Son of God for secularism's empty promises of happiness through human achievement."One of the newly revamped articles, "Man Repents in Time for Rapture," celebrates this shift in focus, depicting a person coming to faith in Jesus Christ through the powerful, prophetic writing the Bee is known for."I always thought the Babylon Bee was just making fun of people who actually believed stuff like that," said one former critic and avid reader, Joe Schreiber, "but after seeing the moving account of this man's redemption, I'm seriously considering whether or not I need to get right with God."Schreiber's wife, Amanda, added, "I always knew the Bee's satire was a vehicle for sharing the Good News — I mean, they did have that Christian message at the end of each article, even if I didn't read it most of the time. I'm so glad they're taking this bold step to countenance the unsaved in their continual rebellion against the one true God."At press time, Ford and the Bee were congratulating each other on the new direction, as well as the warm reception from their faithful followers and newfound fans. "I really believe this is a divine intervention," said Ford, "and that the Bee will be a forerunner to the glorious truths that will soon be evident to every nation, tribe, and tongue."Schreiber also reported that he had the opportunity to share the gospel with his unsaved friend Mike, who was unfamiliar with the Bee's revised approach to writing and skeptical of the reality of Christ's life, death, and resurrection. "It actually made it pretty easy to talk to him about God's love and Jesus' redemption," he said, "although I'm still praying for Mike's salvation."

prompt: Write satirical article with headline: "Study Finds Connection Between Wearing A Mask And Being A Big Sissy"
reference: U.S. - Studies have shown that wearing masks can help slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, but a new alarming study shows that wearing a mask has a downside: It greatly increases your chance of being a big sissy."The results are incredible," said sissiness researcher Winston Sullivan. "Someone could seem perfectly normal, but as soon as they put on a mask, you're all, 'Aww. Is the poor little guy scared of getting the flu?' Total wussification, as it's known in my field."According to the study, when some of the participants wore masks, Sullivan felt compelled to knock them to the ground and shout names at them. "And all they did in response," Sullivan explained, "was say, 'Is this part of the experiment?' What a bunch of dorks."Sullivan did say that in certain situations wearing a mask could not make you a sissy, such as if it were "part of an entire ninja ensemble." "But if you don't know kung fu," Sullivan said, "it definitely just makes you a big sissy."Sullivan did admit the masks were somewhat effective in keeping people from "infecting each other with the 'rona and dying and stuff," which is worth noting if "you're the sort of nerd who cares about that."
candidate: The age of COVID has brought with it many controversial topics. One such topic is the effectiveness of face masks. While studies have shown that masks do indeed reduce the spread of COVID, some people have taken to mocking those who choose to wear masks. Enter this study, with absolutely shocking results. A recent study conducted by the Institute of Science of Big Deal found a surprising correlation between mask wearing and a particular personality trait. "Our research shows a strong connection between people who wear masks and those who exhibit big sissy traits," says Dr. Alexander Mass, the principal investigator on this study. Mass continues, "We analyzed a population of approximately 500 individuals, and compared those who chose to wear a mask with those who did not. We found that many of the individuals who preferred to wear a mask exhibited traits often associated with feminity. Such as the enjoyment of baking or an affinity for dresses." When asked if this study was seriously flawed, Mass replied, "Well, the data suggests that individuals who wear masks are typically more concerned with others' safety than their own. Which, in our opinion, is a bit queer. However, we are a scientific institution, so we can't judge anyone too harshly for that. It's literally in our foundation principles." While the results of this study may be controversial, Mass did offer some advice. "If you are one of those people who choose to wear a mask, and you are worried about being perceived as a big sissy, we recommend you just embrace it. Nothing is more embarrassing than trying to conform to societal pressures. Particularly when those pressures dictate you behave like a brute. Don't be a brute, wear your mask." This study has certainly shaken the world of COVID research. Perhaps there is more to wearing a mask than preventing the spread of disease. Perhaps, deep down, we are all big sissys. Thank you, Science.

prompt: Write satirical article with headline: "Benny Hinn Travels To Dagobah To Master His Power To Knock People Over"
reference: DAGOBAH, OUTER RIM - Benny Hinn is one of the best-known miraculous healers in the galaxy. His powers are formidable -- but he hasn't yet completed his training. So, Hinn got in his private jet and flew to Dagobah to complete his training in the ways of the Force with Jedi Master Yoda."Reach your hand out you must and knock over that stump," said Yoda."I will try," Hinn replied."Do, or do not. There is no try.""Well, I mean, I'm just going to declare victory over it," Hinn explained."That is why you fail," Yoda replied.Yoda set up various training courses in the swamps of Dagobah, from training dummies Hinn would have to try to pickpocket to a whole line of dummies he would have to knock over with his mind.In one horrible training session, Hinn went into a dark cave and was confronted by John MacArthur. "NOOOOO!!!!" Hinn screamed, running for his life after he was unable to knock MacArthur down with his Force powers.Yoda shook his head and smacked Hinn with his cane. "Fear is the path to the dark side. Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering. I sense much fear in you.""Well, that all sounds pretty bad. But will I make a lot of money?""Oh, yeah, for sure," Yoda said."OK, cool," Hinn replied before pulling his private jet out of the swamp with his mind and flying back to his home planet.
candidate: Pastor Benny Hinn has reportedly traveled to the planet Dagobah to master his notoriously erratic powers. The controversial televangelist and self-proclaimed healer has long been known for his aggressive approach to worship, famously knocking over members of his audience with sudden bursts of enthusiasm. However, Hinn's abilities have recently become more volatile, with numerous reports of churchgoers being flung across the room to astonishing distances.In a statement, Hinn revealed that he had encountered Yoda in a dream, who agreed to train him in the ways of harnessing the Force and mental control. "I woke up sweating and shouting 'Jesus!' but it wasn't a holy spirit outburst, it was just a weird dream," Hinn said. "Yet, it felt real, you know? Like, I could actually feel the wisdom of the Master Jedi guiding me. It was like being filled with the holy spirit, but with more lightsabers." While the pastor maintains that the dream was divinely inspired, many are skeptical of Hinn's newfound obsession with Star Wars."I mean, it's one thing to preach on the fruits of the spirit, but it's totally weird to start talking about Jedi mind tricks and Force ghosts," said Mary Swanson, a longtime member of Hinn's Phoenix Revival Fellowship. "I don't think Jesus would have chosen Yoda as a sidekick." Despite the criticism, Hinn remains confident that his journey to master the dark art (sith?) of spirituality is one that will benefit his followers. "I'm going to learn how to knock people over in God's name," Hinn said. "But I'm also going to learn how to not knock people over in God's name. That's something people seem to forget about the Force: the light side and the dark side are always there." Until Hinn can learn to balance his powers, he has instructed his followers to wear protective headgear to church services. "It's for their safety," Hinn stated. "I don't want to hit someone with a force push and then have them crack their head on a pew. That's bad ministry." While the journey ahead is long, Hinn remains confident that he can become a true master of the spiritual arts. "I'm going to evangelize across the galaxy," Hinn proclaimed. "And maybe stop off at Tatooine to sell some of my pricey holy water." The pastor has yet to respond to allegations that it is actually a powerful Sith Lord who has been manipulating his actions from the start.

prompt: Write satirical article with headline: "White House Adds Cry Room For Fussy Reporters"
reference: WASHINGTON, D.C. - The Trump White House has added a new feature to the James S. Brady Press Briefing Room: a separate cry room for fussy reporters who are crying during press briefings and interrupting the proceedings.The quiet, serene room will allow news agencies to take their crying, wailing, fussy reporters into a separate space to calm them down so the press briefings can continue without interruption."If you notice one of your reporters starting to tear up, just take them into the cry room and soothe them before joining us again," said Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany. "There are pictures of Obama, bottles of kombucha, and some Tickle-You-Biden plushies in there to keep them occupied and help them feel safe.""Hey, wait a minute! Are you saying we're babies!?" shouted one reporter, tears welling up in his eyes."Well, yes," McEnany replied."That's... that's mean!" His lip began to quiver and he was forced to excuse himself to the cry room."WAAAAHHH!!!" cried Jim Acosta. "ORANGE MAN BAD! ORANGE MAN BAD!" One of his fellow CNN reporters cradled him in her arms and took him out into the cry room with an apologetic look on her face.The cry room may need expanding soon, however, since every single reporter except OANN's Chanel Rion was sent to the cry room during the first press briefing. Rion pointed and laughed at them as they went into the cry room, calling them "dumb babies," which made them cry harder.
candidate: Sure! Here is a satirical article with the headline "White House Adds Cry Room For Fussy Reporters":"The White House has recently come under fire for appearing to be overly sensitive to the needs of the press. In an unprecedented move, the administration has decided to install a dedicated cry room within the West Wing after an especially grueling press briefing left several reporters in tears.The decision has drawn a range of reactions, with some praising the administration's compassion, while others view it as a deflection of accountability.According to sources within the White House, the cry room was conceived during a particularly challenging briefing concerning rising inflation, supply chain disruptions, and the administration's fumbled response to the climate crisis. When reporters pushed for answers regarding the administration's plans to address these issues, Press Secretary Alexa Coniff became overwhelmed, abruptly leaving the briefing room to compose herself.Several reporters present expressed concern for her well-being, with some longstanding members of the press corps recalling the more aggressive questioning of past administrations and empathizing with her discomfort.At this point, President McCaskill, who was present for the briefing and has taken an active interest in diversifying the media facilities, had the idea of repurposing an unused office near the briefing room as a cry room."As an administration that values emotional safety, empathy, and inclusivity, we felt it was imperative to provide a safe space for journalists to express their emotions and recharge if they become overwhelmed during our many challenging briefings," explained President McCaskill, demonstrating the administration's flair for the eminently understandable and relatable.Some critics, however, see this move as an avoidance of tough questions and a deflection of the administration's responsibility to the American people."It's absurd that the White House would rather provide coddling and comfort for reporters than actually answer their questions," said former Press Secretary Barry Suntown, who now hosts the influential podcast, 'Baring It All.' "A cry room might have been appropriate twenty years ago when we were all still trying to process the trauma of Y2K, but today, we need answers, not tears."This installation adds to other, previously unnoticed amenities designed to cater to the press corps' specialized needs, such as the recently restocked fridge filled with highly nutritional choices like Ensure and VitaminWater, and the spacious changing table in the nearby men's room should any reporters require a place to express their feelings in a more physical sense.Many are unsure if this press room is a step forward for transparency and press accommodation or a sign of dystopian fragility. Yet, as long as these rooms are accessible, we can only hope that every future press secretary and elected official might have the opportunity to soothe their emotions in absolutely any way they desire."I hope this article captures the tone and style you were looking for! Let me know if you would like me to make any adjustments or write another satirical article on a different topic.

prompt: Write satirical article with headline: "Children Threaten To Help"
reference: MAPLE BLUFFS, IA - Justin Daniels was painting the kitchen, already working hard to not drop paint on anything where paint didn't go, when a further complication was added: His five-year-old and three-year-old sons expressed a desire to help."I knew instilling in my children a desire to help others was going to come back to haunt me," Daniels told reporters. "I mean, can you imagine? It would take at least twice as long and I'd be cleaning paint off the counters for days."Daniels tried to come up with some menial tasks for the kids, such as putting painter's tape on things that didn't particularly need it, but the children insisted on helping with the core task of painting."That's when I came up with a brilliant idea," Daniels said. "I told them I was so happy that they were such good children who wanted to help that I'd reward them with a new video game. It cost me sixty bucks, but it took away any desire they had to help anyone with anything."With the children playing their new video game, Daniels was able to paint in peace, other than his kids occasionally screaming at each other.
candidate: Sure! We never anticipated they would one day use this newfound confidence to threaten adults."In light of these incidents, it's important for authorities and parents to establish clear boundaries and rules for these overachieving munchkins. The scope of this issue is unparalleled, affecting adults in every realm of life, from the workplace to domestic responsibilities. Perhaps what we need is a reminder of the children's anthem, "He's Got the Whole World in His Hands," to remind these pint-sized Napoleons that they are inherently powerless and incapable of truly helping anyone other than petting a cat affectionately.

prompt: Write satirical article with headline: "Trump Replaces Washington Monument With Giant Can Of Goya Beans"
reference: WASHINGTON, D.C. - Liberals have been complaining about the Washington Monument, which is named after the notorious racist George Washington. Well, Trump is now appeasing them, having taken down the century-old obelisk, replacing it with a 350-foot-tall can of Goya pinto beans.The authentic Goya can is 350 feet tall and 200 feet wide and contains 82,252,607 gallons of beans."This is the largest can of Goya beans, maybe ever," said President Trump at the dedication ceremony. "Way bigger than some of the other countries' statues and monuments. This thing makes the Eiffel Tower look laughable. I mean that literally. You look at the Eiffel Tower and you just laugh. It's not even finished. You can still see the frame. And does it have beans? Well, maybe at that snooty French restaurant. But probably not. Probably not. They just have dumb French food like cheese with funny names and bread. Admittedly the bread smells pretty good, but it doesn't live up to that when you eat it. Always smells better than it tastes. Everyone says so."Liberals tried to criticize the move but were unable to do so since they would be siding with George Washington. Plus, the optics of tearing down a monument to a Latino businessman would just be bad. "We've been played again," said Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi. "This guy really is a genius."
candidate: Our fearless leader, Donald J. Trump, continues to astonish and amaze after four years of historic accomplishments. His latest feat, an innovative rebranding of the iconic Washington Monument, has the Left grasping at straws and begging the question: "What can't Trump accomplish?"In a shocking turn of events, the towering Washington Monument has been replaced with a gigantic, gold can of Goya beans, showcasing Trump's unwavering support for Hispanic entrepreneurship and canned food enthusiasts alike.The announcement sent shockwaves through the lifeless DC bureaucracy, with horrified liberals grasping at any and every argument to discredit this culinary masterpiece."This is an egregious assault on our nation's heritage," screamed dysfunctional Democratic congresswoman Sheila Jackson-Lee, who ironically has spent decades clogging up the system with her incessant complaints about everything.But Trump, ever the marketing guru, countered with an ingenious solution, "Who needs some old, white obelisk when you can have this sleek, golden can of cultural diversity and culinary delight?"The leftists scream about the wasteful taxpayer funds spent on this project, but honestly, who better to spend our hard-earned money than Trump? Isn't the American economy booming like never before? Isn't this new monument a symbol of cultural unity and entrepreneurial ingenuity? Isn't it just sheer excellence?Sure, there may be a few grumblers who miss the old monument, but Trump has assured us that the can of Goya beans is just the first step in a bold new vision for America's national landmarks.So, buckle up, folks! Whether it's a Mount Rushmore-esq depiction of Trump's head made entirely of Big Mac burgers or a towering Statue of Liberty crafted with Gillette men's razors, Trump is here to revolutionize the very essence of what it means to be American. And to the liberals who complain about the smell of sautéed beans wafting through the city: You can always count on our powerful Trump-endorsed nostrils! Smell nothing else, smell victory!In conclusion, grab a can of Goya beans, crack a cold one, and revel in the liberating sensation that is making America great again! Note: This satirical article expresses exaggerated viewpoints for comic effect, and solely serves to entertain readers. Any resemblance to actual persons or events is purely coincidental.

prompt: Write satirical article with headline: "Hack Suspected As Biden Posts Complete, Coherent Thought On Twitter"
reference: U.S. - Hackers have been blamed as Joe Biden posted a complete, coherent thought on Twitter earlier today.As soon as Twitter support saw that Biden had posted several complete sentences in a tweet, they immediately locked his account down, suspecting a hack."The full, rational sentences were a dead giveaway," said a Twitter IT guy. "If you're gonna pretend to be Joe Biden, you have to add in several rambling asides, some made-up words, and three or four major gaffes. It clearly wasn't him, so we took steps to lock down his account.""Hackers, you know, thhhhe--the thing that, that hacks--hackers are dangerous," said Joe Biden in a statement to the press. "Back in my day, hackers were the guys who would cut down your telegram wire and listen in on the ol' party line. My cousin, Velma, she once said..." At this point, he abruptly fell asleep.Meanwhile, President Trump's account posted several deranged rants about random stuff, assuring everyone that his account had not been compromised.
candidate: A shocking development rocked the world of social media on Wednesday after President Joseph R. Biden Jr. posted a complete sentence onto his Twitter account. The tweet, which has since been deleted from the platform, caused widespread panic and speculation as users struggled to make sense of the coherent thought expressed in the 280 characters.According to reports, the tweet, which read "America is back" sparked a slew of conspiracy theories from hackers to political sabotage at a global level. Experts in the field of cryptography and satellite communications are currently reviewing the tweet, considering the possibility of a coded message containing essential intelligence information.One hacker, known only as "The Cyber Phantom", spoke to our reporter anonymously under the condition of strict anonymity. He detailed how he had heard about the tweet being shared in certain dark web circles. "I was browsing the dark web, as usual, and came across some mentions of this tweet on a few of the forums. At first, I didn't take it seriously, but then I saw the same tweet posted on an alt-right message board with the caption "We did it." Spooked me out of my mind. If the dark forces of the alt-right have broken into the White House's social accounts, we could be in for some rocky times."Political analysts also saw this as a pivotal moment in modern politics. With the upcoming 2024 presidential elections, this tweet could drastically shift the political landscape, potentially giving Biden a much-needed boost in the polls. "It is unprecedented," commented one political scientist from the University of Maryland. "We have seen the devastating impact of social media on politics, from the rise of fake news to toxic cancel culture, but never has a perfectly structured sentence appeared on a president's account. This could be a game-changer. Regardless of political affiliation, we should embrace this new era of clarity and transparency."While the tweet has since been deleted, its impact will forever be etched into the history of modern satire and social media. The incident serves as a reminder of the ever-evolving nature of the internet, leaving us always bracing for what might come next. Update: Additional context is provided regarding the president's tweet. Earlier this morning, the President's social media manager released the following statement:"The President was merely emphasizing the core message of his administration: a commitment to restoring America's global leadership and upholding its foundational values. In this case, invoking the iconic phrase, 'America is back' reflects our determination to promote democracy, human rights, and collaborative diplomacy after the previous administration's erratic and isolating policies."Yet, in a surprising turn of events, a new variant of the Twitter hack has been uncovered. Multiple prominent figures, including the President, were found to have uploaded photoshopped images of themselves with unusual haircuts. Among them, President Biden's new hairstyle, dubbed the "Merman Look" by internet users, sparked conversations across social platforms. One insider close to the President's staff commented, "After the events of last week, we are conducting a full investigation into the security breach. In the meantime, we ask the public to focus on the President's policies rather than these trivial matters." The story develops quickly, and we will keep you updated as more information arises.

prompt: Write satirical article with headline: "Kanye West Drops Out Of Race After Elon Musk Offers Him Position As President Of Mars"
reference: LOS ANGELES, CA - Kanye West has dropped out of the presidential race, several sources confirmed today, after Elon Musk offered to instead make him president of Mars."America is great and all, but being president of Mars would be the greatest of all time," West said. "Of all time."Musk said he had a great conversation with West where he convinced him not to aim too low but instead to "shoot for the stars.""Kanye has way more potential than just being president of America," Musk said. "Frankly, being president of the U.S. is beneath him. Mars is where it's at. It will be way better than any government on this planet."West then showed Musk his crude drawings for a rocket ship to Mars he'd designed in his spare time, called the Yeezymobile. The Yeezymobile is made of "space metal" and runs on Chick-fil-A peanut oil: a "100% environmentally friendly" design, according to West."And that big fin on the back adds at least 1,000 horsepower," West said."I love this guy's enthusiasm," said Musk as he looked over the drawing. "We'll have to make a few changes so the craft will obey the laws of physics, but this is a great start. Hey, who are those two stick figures in the front?""That's me and you, Musk. Me and you," West said, looking up at the stars and putting his arm around his entrepreneurial friend. "We are gonna be the kings of the universe, my friend. The kings of the universe."
candidate: Kanye West, the eccentric and egotistic rapper-turned-entrepreneur, has dropped out of the race for President of the United States, citing a lucrative offer from Elon Musk to become the first President of Mars. In a surprise announcement, West revealed that he had been in secret discussions with the tech billionaire behind the recent acquisition of Twitter. "I am thrilled to announce that I have received an offer that I simply couldn't refuse," said West during a hastily arranged press conference. "Elon Musk has presented me with a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to not only shape the future of this nation but the fate of an entire planet." According to sources close to the purported deal, Musk made an enticing offer to West, convincing him to forego his ambitions of ruling Earth and instead embark on a new path as the charismatic leader of the Martian colony. The proposed role is said to encompass overseeing the development and expansion of Martian cities, implementing out-of-this-world policies, and crafting innovative architectural designs to transform the reddish-hued desert planet into a bustling hub of creativity and innovation. Industry experts speculate that this unexpected turn of events could be the result of a strategic alliance between Musk and West, aiming to divert attention and resources away from the contentious presidential race underway on Earth. "Kanye brings a unique blend of artistic vision, bold creativity, and an unwavering belief in the transformative power of self-proclaimed greatness. These qualities make him the ideal candidate to lead Mars into a new era," said Elon Musk, enigmatically. Musk's recent activities, including the takeover of Twitter and his ambitious space exploration ventures, have dominated the headlines in recent months. Speculation has been rife about his intentions and potential motivations for offloading such a prestigious role to West. Many believe this move could help Musk's ongoing mission to revolutionize how humanity expands its footprint beyond Earth. While the specifics of the agreement remain shrouded in secrecy, sources close to the pair claim that West would assume the role of "President of Mars" immediately and would be charged with shaping the future of the Martian colony, including the recruitment and governance of its pioneering citizens. The agreement is rumored to have several perks, including creative control over the visual aesthetic of the Martian cities, free access to the world's first intergalactic Uber Pool, and exclusive permission to name the planets and moons of the Martian solar system. At the press conference, West further alluded to his grand vision for the red planet, speaking passionately about his desire to create a cultural mecca, free from the constraints of terrestrial politics. "I have always envisioned a world that embraces individuality, creativity, and limitless possibilities. Mars will be this mecca of humanity, where the great unification of the greatest artistic minds can manifest without the distractions and limitations of our current Earthly reality," asserted West, invoking his signature mix of lofty rhetoric and self-promotion. West's announcement has sent shockwaves through the already fragmented world of presidential politics, leaving many wondering if this is an elaborate publicity stunt or a genius maneuver by Musk to redirect attention and resources towards his extraterrestrial endeavors. The former presidential candidate declined to disclose whether he plans to sell any of his earthly possessions, such as his ranch in Wyoming, to aid in the migration process to Mars. For now, the plans for the proposed trip remain shrouded in secrecy, leaving many questioning whether West's devoted fan base will be offered exclusive promotional packages to join him on this cosmic venture. As the dust settles from this unexpected announcement, the American public now faces a choice: pine for the tantalizing prospect of Kanye West as President of Mars or continue to focus on the crucial decision of who will lead the country through the trials and tribulations of Earthly politics. Only time will tell if this satirical scoop becomes reality or if West's departure from the presidential race is nothing more than a skillfully crafted distraction. # #KanyeWest #President #ElonMusk #Mars #Politics #Satire

prompt: Write satirical article with headline: "More People Voluntarily Committing Themselves To Asylums To Escape Insanity Of Real World"
reference: U.S. - More people are voluntarily committing themselves to mental institutions in an attempt to escape the ever-increasing insanity of the real world.Thousands of people have checked themselves in at psychiatric wards across the country, claiming to be insane, in order to get away from the absolute insanity of everything that's happening outside."Oh yeah, I'm totally crazy, 100%," said Frank Zwygart as he checked himself in to an asylum in Arkham. "I think I'm Napoleon Bonaparte or whatever. Yep, totally insane.""That guy over there swinging the golf club at the orderly thinks we're living in a simulation, while Bob over in the corner thinks he's God," said recently committed man Frank Zwygart. "So yeah, it's a little less crazy than things out there. We don't worry about stuff like Kanye running for president, murder hornets, nunchuck bears, bubonic squirrels, World War 3, or getting doxxed for old tweets. And they've got lots of great board games in here.""Plus, Bob's actually a pretty cool guy once you get to know him," he added as he adjusted his straitjacket. "Actually, he's totally sane -- his beliefs make perfect sense to him. There's an internal logic to everything he believes, unlike some of the crazies you try to talk to out there in the crazy world."
candidate: Asylum Seekers Opting For Sanity Withdrawal From Reality Insanity is the new sanity as more and more people are voluntarily committing themselves to asylums to escape the harrowing reality of the world today. In a shocking development, scores of individuals are opting for various degrees of psychiatric hospitalization to take a break from the burdens of everyday life. A recent study by the University of Sanity has found that the rate of sanity deterioration is higher than ever before, with many choosing to withdraw completely from reality in favor of a more comfortable life inside an asylum. Speaking to journalists, one such individual, Jason Shell-Shock, a 38-year-old accountant, said, "I've had enough of this crazy world. I wake up every day to the never-ending onslaught of depressing news, from climate disasters to political unrest and economic turmoil. My sanity has been on a downward spiral for some time now." Jason is one of many opting for a break from reality within the safe confines of an institution. In fact, as he packs his things to head into his voluntary hospitalization, he states, "I'm looking forward to some much-needed rest and recuperation behind the padded walls of this asylum. Sure, I might be diagnosed with a few made-up ailments to justify my confinement, but at least I can get some sleep without constant nightmares." The study by the University of Sanity found that the majority of people opting for voluntary institutionalization are individuals in their late teens through late thirties, primarily due to the stresses the modernized world places on this demographic. In the past year, the rate of admissions to psychiatric hospitals has skyrocketed, with many citing "real-world exhaustion" as the primary reason for their admittance. Many who have been admitted claim that they feel like they're on the brink of a complete mental breakdown, and asylum admission is their only hope for salvation from the ravages of modern life. Psychiatrists, however, maintain a cautious but optimistic outlook on this disturbing trend. On the surface, this may appear to be a worrying decline in mental stability, but experts believe that these individuals are making a rational decision to protect their sanity. "Lack of control over external circumstances and the resulting stress can lead to significant mental health issues. These people are making a very brave choice to take a step back, regain control, and prioritize their own well-being. It's a radical act of self-care in a world that doesn't always allow for it," says Dr. Elizabeth Ann Vikki, a renowned psychologist and expert on sanity withdrawal. Dr. Vikki believes that while the rise of voluntary commitment to asylums is alarming in its proportions, it is a reflection of the extreme pressures exerted on individuals by a harsh and unforgiving society. "We live in trying times. To expect people to endure nonstop bad news and still maintain a steady state of sanity is unrealistic. It's crucial that we, as a society, provide more support and respite for individuals to cope with the daily horrors we subject them to," Dr. Vikki says, urging lawmakers to mitigate the harsh realities of the real world. Some, however, see this institutionalization as a ploy to avoid facing the harsh realities of a collapsing world. Environmental activist, Greta Realist, argues, "Voluntarily checking into asylums is a cop-out. We can't afford to ignore the world crumbling around us. Instead of running away, we must learn to fight the powers that exploit and destroy our world." Regardless of the divisiveness of response, the fact remains that psychiatric hospitalizations are on the rise. It remains to be seen what implications this has for the future of a sanity withdrawal, but insiders suggest that more aggressive marketing toward sanity preservation may be in the works. "On a positive note, at least now we have a growing market for asylums and psychiatric services, offering new opportunities for entrepreneurs and corporate stakeholders to capitalize on this emerging sector. It's a win-win for capitalism, even if it marks a steep decline in widespread sanity," said one investor, who wished to remain anonymous. As for Shell-Shock, he's looking forward to his time inside, "I'll take the padded walls, the medication, and the round-the-clock supervision any day over the alternative. Maybe I'll even convince them I'm ready to face reality again in a few months, but for now, I'm happy to remain blissfully unaware." With the rate of voluntary commitments showing no signs of slowing, it's apparent that, for many, the idea of facing the realities of the world is becoming increasingly unpalatable.
